gnat.filter.ner
Class RunDictionaries

java.lang.Object
  gnat.filter.ner.RunDictionaries
All Implemented Interfaces:
Filter
public class RunDictionaries
extends java.lang.Object
implements Filter

Filter that contacts local or remote DictionaryServers to perform NER.

The mapping of species to server addresses is stored in a file found via the ISGNProperties entry taxon2port. This file has two tab-separated columns for NCBI taxon ID and server address with port ("128.10.11.12:56001"); a third column for comments is optional. If the server address is a single number, we assume this points to a local port (localhost, 127.0.0.1).

Author:
Joerg

Field Summary
(package private)  java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> availableServersForSpecies
          Stores for which species the specified server was available at instantiation time.
(package private)  java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> excludeTaxons
          Do not run dictionaries for the taxon IDs given in excludeTaxons, even if they are specified via the properties/configuration files.
Note: excludeTaxons overwrites limitToTaxons: if a taxon is included in both sets, it will be excluded.
(package private)  java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> limitToTaxons
          Run dictionaries only for the species given in excludeTaxons, even if others are also specified via the properties/configuration files.
Note: excludeTaxons overwrites limitToTaxons: if a taxon is included in both sets, it will be excluded.
private  java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.String[]> taxonToServerPortMap
          Mapping of species taxon ID to a server address (server:port").

 void addExcludeTaxon(int taxon)
          Set the filter to not invoke dictionary servers for the given taxon.
Note: adds this taxon to the existing list in excludeTaxons; set the complete list with setExcludeTaxons(Set).
 void addLimitToTaxon(int taxon)
          Add a taxon to invoke dictionary servers only for specified taxons.
Note: adds this taxon to the existing set limitToTaxons; set the complete list with setLimitToTaxons(Set).
Note: the set excludeTaxons overwrites the set limitToTaxons - if a taxon is contained in both sets, the dictionary for this taxon will not be invoked.

Field Detail

taxonToServerPortMap

private java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.String[]> taxonToServerPortMap
Mapping of species taxon ID to a server address (server:port"). Loaded from the file given by the ISGNProperties entry taxon2port.

availableServersForSpecies

java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> availableServersForSpecies
Stores for which species the specified server was available at instantiation time.

excludeTaxons

java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> excludeTaxons
Do not run dictionaries for the taxon IDs given in excludeTaxons, even if they are specified via the properties/configuration files.
Note: excludeTaxons overwrites limitToTaxons: if a taxon is included in both sets, it will be excluded.

limitToTaxons

java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> limitToTaxons
Run dictionaries only for the species given in excludeTaxons, even if others are also specified via the properties/configuration files.
Note: excludeTaxons overwrites limitToTaxons: if a taxon is included in both sets, it will be excluded.

RunDictionaries

public RunDictionaries()
Method Detail

filter

public void filter(Context context,
                   TextRepository textRepository,
                   GeneRepository geneRepository)
Filters the context by invoking each relevant dictionary server to the texts in textRepository.
Relies on Text.taxonIDs to determine the species for each Text. Considers excludeTaxons and limitToTaxons to restrict the species for each text further.

Specified by:
filter in interface Filter
Parameters:
context -
textRepository -
geneRepository -

getDictionaryServers

boolean getDictionaryServers(java.lang.String dictionaryMappingFile,
                             java.lang.String defaultServer)
Reads the configuration for remote dictionary server from the config file to load the taxonToServerPortMap; also tries to contact every dictionary server.

Parameters:
dictionaryMappingFile -
Returns:
true if every dictionary was available (and the config file was readable)

public boolean isLimited(int taxon)
Checks whether the given taxon ID is valid and its corresponding dictionary should be used, accordint to limitToTaxons.

hasLimited

public boolean hasLimited()
Checks whether dictionary calls should be limited to certain species.
Returns true if limitToTaxons contains at least one taxon ID.

Returns:

setLimitToTaxons

public void setLimitToTaxons(java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> taxa)
Set the filter to invoke dictionary servers only for the given taxa.
Note: overwrites the previous setting. Use addLimitToTaxon(int) to add a taxon.
Note: the set excludeTaxons overwrites the set limitToTaxons - if a taxon is contained in both sets, the dictionary for this taxon will not be invoked.

Parameters:
taxa -

addLimitToTaxon

public void addLimitToTaxon(int taxon)
Add a taxon to invoke dictionary servers only for specified taxons.
Note: adds this taxon to the existing set limitToTaxons; set the complete list with setLimitToTaxons(Set).
Note: the set excludeTaxons overwrites the set limitToTaxons - if a taxon is contained in both sets, the dictionary for this taxon will not be invoked.

Parameters:
taxon -
